intro: Aldama purisimae, commonly known as the Mexican Aldama, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
